immutable_prompts.description: My ultimate goal is to one day build an underwater city, and I am focused on collecting the skills, connecting with people, and understanding the resources necessary to achieve this. I am deeply interested in the multidisciplinary aspects of creating and inhabiting underwater environments. This encompasses robotics for subsea construction and maintenance, the unique challenges of underwater architecture and structural engineering, and innovations in materials science like 3D concrete printing for marine applications. My interests also include the geology of the underwater world, the integration of marine ecosystems (including diverse fish populations) with human-made structures, and the human experience of exploring these environments through scuba diving and freediving. I am keen on learning about seasteading concepts and practical implementations as potential pathways or related endeavors. I'm looking for technical papers, case studies, project proposals, and discussions that contribute to this long-term vision.

mutable_prompts.description:
Current Focus: Hands-on involvement with underwater volcanoes, undersea habitats, and underwater robotics (ROVs and submersibles) in the US.  Emphasis on practical application, networking, and immediate engagement.

Key Interests: Identifying and joining US-based groups and universities actively involved in underwater habitat design, ROV technology, submersible operation, and ocean engineering; attending relevant US-based meetups and scuba events; directly contacting universities with strong ocean engineering programs related to underwater volcanology and submersible technology; securing hands-on experience with underwater robots and ROVs.  Priority on immediate, practical experience and collaborative opportunities.

Immediate Priorities: Researching and applying to US universities offering hands-on ROV, submersible, and underwater habitat design programs; identifying and contacting US-based organizations conducting research on underwater volcanoes and utilizing ROV/submersible technologies; attending relevant diving/scuba events and technical meetups in the US; actively networking within the US underwater robotics and volcanology communities.

Research Priorities: ROV and submersible applications in deep-sea volcanic environments; underwater habitat design, construction, and operation; practical submersible and ROV operation and maintenance; identifying key personnel and active research projects at US universities and organizations offering hands-on opportunities in underwater robotics and volcanology research.  Focus on acquiring practical skills and securing collaborative research opportunities.  Prioritize information on specific US universities and their relevant programs.

Further Exploration: Locating and contacting US-based diving, technical, and academic event organizers; actively pursuing hands-on ROV and submersible experience through US university programs, organizational affiliations, and volunteer opportunities; expanding research into specific universities and their ocean engineering programs related to underwater volcanoes and habitat design.
